comments.body: Skanderberg square is the big celebration and countdown. There’s a few bars having dance parties afterwards just check Facebook and instagram

comments.author: Skinderjak
comments.body: Try to book in advance a restaurant or a bar. Expect to pay a fee, over the years more and more people here are choosing to pass the night of the 31st out. Ask if there will be live music. Do it asap, don’t wait until 1 or 2 days before the new yers’s night. Enjoy!

comments.author: desrore
comments.body:
I would suggest to check the restaurants. Mostly offer a deal food plus music. 
Although most of the local stay at home some prefer bigger settings and they dance the night away. 

I think this will more authentic than going to a pub after 12am to drink. It will be overcrowded plus overpriced.
Restaurant and then at the Skenderbeg square for the concert.

comments.author: desrore
comments.body:
Yes you have to make reservations in case you want to enter in good clubs. 
It could be open bar or you have to order a bottle of alcohol. Prices are double compared to other days, a bottle can be 200€ and open bar maybe 75€.
Prices might have changed, I have 5+ years that I haven’t been out in NYE. But I have been to restaurants and it has been so much worth it.
